edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator
Class KSClient

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator.KSClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class KSClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

A KSClient provides the functionality to connect to a server simulator and playback the currently running controller on that server. It is important to note that the client simulator is not running a controller of its own, rather displaying what the server controller is doing.

Constructor Summary
KSClient()
          Allocate a new, not-connected KSClient.
 
Method Summary
protected  void initialize(KSFrame frame, java.lang.String host, int port)
          Initializes, connects this KSClient, and starts it on a separate thread.
protected  boolean isStarted()
          Indicates that this client is connected and currently may or may not be sending or receiving data.
protected  void kill()
          Terminate communication with the server.

Constructor Detail

KSClient

public KSClient()
Allocate a new, not-connected KSClient.

Method Detail

initialize

protected void initialize(KSFrame frame,
                          java.lang.String host,
                          int port)
Initializes, connects this KSClient, and starts it on a separate thread.

Parameters:
frame - a reference to the local simulator
host - the host name of a server
port - the port number that the server is listening

isStarted

protected boolean isStarted()
Indicates that this client is connected and currently may or may not be sending or receiving data.

Returns:
true if this client is started and connected to a server.

kill

protected void kill()
Terminate communication with the server. There is no graceful way to tell the server this client is done. However the server is robust enough to recover and release any resources.

run

public void run()
Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
